text:
Currently this is what I do:
Record an HTTP session.
Open the .jmx file in a text editor.
Delete all elements pertaining to server/ip and port.
Open the test file in Jmeter.
Add an HTTP Defaults controller.

It would be useful if I could delete all those elements from the Jmeter GUI to 
make my test repeatable against different machines.
creator: blee@llnl.gov

creator: myphsto@hotmail.com
text:
Just a quick comment on this one.  I've found that if you put a recording or
simple controller in your thread group as the target for the recording proxy
results, what happens is it will remove the server, protocol etc that are
already defined in your defaults controller if they match up.  Bottom line,
always have your defaults controler match what you record, and always target
something in that thread group so jmeter removes the extra info for you.

Hope this helps.
